fdd:FDD.titleName: MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding, Non-FRExt Extensions

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: ISO/IEC 14496-10:2003. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 10: Advanced Video Coding (formal name); MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding, Extensions (common name)

fdd:description.p: Extended version of the compression encoding for video documented as Advanced Video Coding (AVC) in part 10 of the ISO/IEC 14496 standard. The extensions are ones that require the use of MP4_FF_AVCE (MPEG-4 file format for extended AVC) as a wrapper, and they include independent and disposable sample boxes, sample groups, random access recovery points, or new structures in movie fragments. It is not clear to the compiler of this document what relationship may obtain between these extensions and MPEG-4_AVC_EP (Advanced Video Coding, Extended Profile); comments are welcome.

The extensions described here predate the FRExt (Fidelity Range Extensions), being finalized in 2005 and represented by four new profiles: MPEG-4_AVC_HP, MPEG-4_AVC_H10P, MPEG-4_AVC_H422P, and MPEG-4_AVC_H444P.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Extended version of the compression encoding for video documented as Advanced Video Coding (AVC) in part 10 of the ISO/IEC 14496 standard. The extensions are ones that require the use of MP4_FF_AVCE (MPEG-4 file format for extended AVC) as a wrapper, and they include independent and disposable sample boxes, sample groups, random access recovery points, or new structures in movie fragments.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MPEG-4 File Format for AVC (Ext), with Non-FRExt Extended AVC Coding

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Open standard. Developed through ISO technical program ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 29 for coding of audio, picture, multimedia and hypermedia information. The working group WG11 (for coding of moving pictures and audio) is also known as the Moving Picture Experts Group (MPEG). See the ISO Standards Catalogue for the list of standards published by ISO/IEC JTC1/SC29. See http://mpeg.chiariglione.org/standards/mpeg-4 for information specific to MPEG-4 and its many parts.

fdd:documentation.p: ISO/IEC 14496-10:2003. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 10: Advanced Video Coding. Additional information in ISO/IEC 14496-15:2004. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 15: Advanced Video Coding (AVC) file format.
See MP4_FF_2 for more information on ISO/IEC 14496.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: See MPEG-4_AVC. MPEG-4_AVC_EXT may prove to be an unused option within the standard; Comments welcome.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Depends upon algorithms and tools to read; will require sophistication to build tools.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:selfDocumentation: Pertains to the file format; some relevant information in MP4_FF_2.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:techProtection: Pertains to the file format; some relevant information in MP4_FF_2.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: Not investigated at this time; comments about the format are welcome.

fdd:soundQF.fdd:normalSound: Not relevant; some information in MP4_FF_2.
fdd:soundQF.fdd:fidelity: Not relevant; some information in MP4_FF_2.
fdd:soundQF.fdd:channels: Not relevant; some information in MP4_FF_2.
fdd:soundQF.fdd:beyondSound: Not relevant; some information in MP4_FF_2.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: File type brand (ISO Base Media File Format)

fdd:notes.fdd:general: AVC bitstreams without a specified profile or with one of three profiles listed in Part 10 (Baseline, MPEG-4_AVC_BP; Main, MPEG-4_AVC_MP; and Extended, MPEG-4_AVC_EP) are wrapped in MP4_FF_2. AVC coding with the extensions listed in this document, however, requires the use of MP4_FF_AVCE as a wrapper. The compiler of this document seeks comments and clarifications regarding the preceding statements.

fdd:citation.fdd:specReference: ISO/IEC 14496-10:2003 Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 10: Advanced Video Coding
ISO/IEC 14496-15:2004 Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 15: Advanced Video Coding (AVC) file format
